trustfund:
TF025759-PHRD-URBAN ENVIRON. &
            MUNICIPAL MGMT.,TF039820-MOZAMBIQUE - MUNICIPAL
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF037557-MOZAMBIQUE - URBAN DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The municipal Development Project is
            expected to improve the environmental conditions in urban
            areas through the successful implementation of civil works
            programs in parallel with dynamic awareness campaigns
            targeting user communities. During the first phase of the
            civil works program, the five municipalities (Beira,
            Quelimane, Nampula, Pemba, and Maputo) will be limiting
            their works to surface water drainage, sewerage and
            sanitation, markets, waste disposal, and rehabilitation of
            pavements and footpaths. 1) During construction, storage or
            cement mixing sites will be located so that they do not
            contaminate local water resources. Awareness campaigns
            involving local communities will be promoted to keep
            drainage channels clean and free of debris. 2) Measures will
            be taken to ensure sanitary conditions are maintained at the
            new markets. 3) Contractual obligations of the contractors
            must include clauses regarding environmental protection,
            especially regarding post-construction site-cleaning.
            Latrines should not be constructed close to ground and
            surface water sources to avoid contamination. 4) Local
            population will be discouraged from using footpaths as
            latrines, and adequate drainage will be provided to preclude
            possible flooding and erosion. 5) Skips equipped with
            tight-ftting lids for waste disposal will be constructed to
            prevent foraging and breeding by pest species.
